dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a big move from the Main Transport Prosecutor's Office in Kazakhstan—overbooking fines are finally coming for domestic routes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a big move from the Main Transport Prosecutor's Office in Kazakhstan-overbooking fines are finally coming for domestic routes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From now on, airlines violating passengers' rights on domestic flights will be fined, the Main Transport Prosecutor's Office reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's specifically 50 monthly calculation indices, which they say is about 196,600 tenge next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's specifically fifty monthly calculation indices, which they say is about one hundred ninety six thousand, six hundred tenge next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under the new provision, airlines may be fined 50 monthly calculation indices (MCI) " equivalent to 196,600 tenge in 2025 " for refusing to provide a seat when a ticket has already been purchased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting, because before this, that kind of liability only applied to international flights, right? So domestic passengers were kinda left in the lurch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting, because before this, that kind of liability only applied to international flights, right? So domestic passengers were kinda left in the lurch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Prosecutor's Office explained that previously, liability for not providing a seat on board despite having a ticket applied only to international flights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And overbooking's such a common practice worldwide—airlines sell extra tickets banking on no-shows, but when everyone shows up, it gets messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And overbooking's such a common practice worldwide-airlines sell extra tickets banking on no-shows, but when everyone shows up, it gets messy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Overbooking is commonly used by international airlines: they deliberately sell more tickets than there are seats on board, expecting that some passengers will not show up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Messy is an understatement. I mean, imagine having a ticket, showing up on time, especially during holidays, and then being told, uh, sorry, no seat for you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Messy is an understatement. I mean, imagine having a ticket, showing up on time, especially during holidays, and then being told, uh, sorry, no seat for you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? The stress and the financial hit—people lose time and money. The Prosecutor's Office mentioned it became a real issue the past couple years on popular domestic routes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? The stress and the financial hit-people lose time and money. The Prosecutor's Office mentioned it became a real issue the past couple years on popular domestic routes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan, the Prosecutor's Office noted that overbooking has become a particularly relevant issue in the past two years, as some airlines began using the practice on popular domestic routes. Despite having paid for their tickets, passengers were left unable to board, losing both time and money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So this new rule should, like, force airlines to be more careful or at least compensate people properly if they do overbook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this new rule should, like, force airlines to be more careful or at least compensate people properly if they do overbook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Hopefully it sets a precedent. Other countries might take note—overbooking's a global annoyance, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hopefully it sets a precedent. Other countries might take note-overbooking's a global annoyance, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's one of those practices that feels almost predatory when you're on the receiving end.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's one of those practices that feels almost predatory when you're on the receiving end.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Let's see if the fines actually make a difference in how airlines operate domestically there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Let's see if the fines actually make a difference in how airlines operate domestically there.
